listitem.para:
Start the ITE from the start menu:
Start-->GUIdancer or Jubula-->GUIdancer or Jubula.
You can also start the ITE using a command line argument.

section.title: Unix Users
section.para: Enter the program name into the shell.

para.para: The ITE uses the current directory as its working directory on Linux systems.

listitem.para: When you start the ITE, a dialog appears asking you to choose a workspace ().

para.para: The workspace is where your preferences are saved.

listitem.para: Select the default workspace offered, or locate new one.

You can choose to always select this workspace using the checkbox.
You can see and change your workspace options in the preferences ().

section.title: Restarting the ITE
section.para:
You can restart the ITE with the current workspace using:
File-->Restart

You can also restart the ITE with a new workspace by selecting:
File-->Switch Workspace

listitem.para: The information contained within this manual is also available in the ITE.
In Windows, press »F1« to see context-sensitive help for the current view.

Select:
Help-->Help Content to search the handbook.

The help preferences can be altered via:
Window-->Preferences-->Help.
See later in this chapter () for details.

section.title: Working with the AUT Agent and client on one machine
section.para: If the ITE and AUT Agent are installed on one machine, there are a few things to be aware of:

listitem.para: Don’t use the mouse or any keyboard shortcuts during execution. The AUT takes control of the machine it is running on during test execution.
Make sure that the AUT is visible during test execution:
The ITE is minimized by default when test execution begins. Make sure that the AUT is the next window to receive focus when the ITE is minimized.

You can change the preference to minimize the ITE via:
Window-->Preferences
If you do this, make sure that the AUT can also be seen on the screen when test execution begins.
